title: Piers Morgan challenges ‘world’s strongest vegan’ as he calls them ‘aggressive’
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Most may know Piers Morgan isn’t a fan of the vegan diet, and he made that very clear when he met vegan strongman Patrik Baboumian today.

Or, rather, a strongman who is a vegan, perhaps.

As 40-year-old Patrik – who won the title of Germany’s Strongest Man in 2011 – prepared to pick up four people on Good Morning Britain on Monday morning, including presenters Laura Tobin and Richard Arnold, Piers wanted to get into the merits of a vegan diet.

Advertisement

But he was also keen to point out what he thought were the shortcomings, which follows on from his previous thoughts on the diet, including that time he raged over Gordon Ramsay’s decision to go vegan.

To Piers this morning, he wanted to know whether or not Patrik became strong through eating meat, seeing as he wasn’t vegan for the first two-and-a-half decades of his life

‘You can’t really say that. The thing is, your body needs protein, right, so if you stop eating protein you’re going to crumble,’ Patrik proceeded to explain to Piers.

‘So if there was anything in meat my body needs, it’s been more than a decade since I ate meat for the last time. Nothing in my body…’

Patrik defended his diet (Picture: ITV/Good Morning Britain)

‘Your residual strength…’ Piers interrupted.

Patrik replied: ‘No, not really,’ but the GMB presenter hit back: ‘For two-thirds of your life you’ve been eating meat.’

As he went on, Piers challenged the bodybuilder, and TV personality James Wilks, who was also on the show, whether or not there were any strongmen/women who had always been vegan, before he said ‘no one was a vegan 20 years ago’.

He had a lot of questions (Picture: ITV/Good Morning Britain)

Susanna Reid, though, his ever balanced co-host, noted with a laugh: ‘People have been vegan longer than Greggs have been making sausage rolls…’

Before Patrik mustered up his strength, Piers wanted to continue to challenge his choice of diet, as he suggested a lot of vegans are ‘aggressive’ in their opinions of the diet and those who alternatively eat meat.

Advertisement

‘Joking apart, I’ve got no problem with people eating whatever diet they want to eat,’ he began. ‘My only problem is vegans can be aggressive [in telling people].’

As Patrik lifted up four adults, he exclaimed to Piers: ‘Are you convinced now?!

We think he was convinced…for now.

Good Morning Britain airs weekdays 6am on ITV.
